definition: to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
words/speech/to say/to talk
(negative prefix)/not/no
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior

sentences.english: Those are blunt, unyielding admonitions that ring in my head every day.
sentences.chinese: 那些直言不諱的忠告每天都在我頭腦中響起。

sentences.english: The Street and media responded well to her bluntness.
sentences.chinese: 業內和媒體對於她的直言不諱反應良好。

sentences.english: The EC is not paid by Pakistan, so I can be outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 由於巴基斯坦不向歐共體交錢，所以我可以直言不諱。
他是一個直言不諱的人。

sentences.english: She minces no words in stating her opinions.
sentences.chinese: 她表達觀點總是直言不諱。

sentences.english: He pointed out the shortcomings in our work time and again without mincing words.
sentences.chinese: 他不止一次直言不諱地指出我們工作中的缺點。

sentences.english: In this case, we will be completely blunt.
sentences.chinese: 在這種情況下，我們將直言不諱。

sentences.english: "What were you shooting at, at the bend?" Agustin asked bluntly.
sentences.chinese: “你在拐彎那裏打誰呢？”奧古斯丁直言不諱地問。

sentences.english: I will speak agaist anything I know to be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我會對我認爲不對的事情直言不諱。

sentences.english: He was a vocal critic of the country's Anti-Homosexuality bill.
sentences.chinese: 他曾直言不諱地批評烏干達反同性戀的法案。

sentences.english: I'll speak aganist anything I know to be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我會對於所有我認爲不對於的事情直言不諱。

sentences.english: , and long one of the more outspoken relatives.
sentences.chinese: 他是死難者親屬中最直言不諱的。

sentences.english: We should listen closely to the outspoken criticisms.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該仔細傾聽直言不諱的批評。

sentences.english: I will speak against anythellong Iknow to be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我會對於所有我認爲不對於的事情直言不諱。

sentences.english: I was rather blunt in my reply.
sentences.chinese: 我的回答相當直言不諱。

sentences.english: But in general, directness is worth a try, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 但是通常情況下，直言不諱還是值得一試。

definition: the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to slander/to smear/to vilify
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to comment on/commentary
leadership
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to look favorably on sth/would be glad to see it happen
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
sequel/continuation of a book
to use one's brains/to think
